nodes.title: ACE Code Editor
nodes.desc: A high-performance code editor for the web, providing features like syntax highlighting, auto-completion, and real-time collaboration. [More Info](https://ace.c9.io/)

nodes.title: Syntax Highlighting
nodes.desc: A feature that displays source code in different colors and fonts according to the category of terms. [More Info](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syntax_highlighting)

nodes.title: Sublime Text
nodes.desc: A popular text editor that competes with ACE in terms of features and user base. [More Info](https://www.sublimetext.com/)

nodes.title: Atom
nodes.desc: A free and open-source text editor that competes with ACE in terms of features and user base. [More Info](https://atom.io/)

nodes.title: Brackets
nodes.desc: A free and open-source text editor that competes with ACE in terms of features and user base. [More Info](https://brackets.io/)

nodes.title: CodeMirror
nodes.desc: A JavaScript library that provides a similar code editing experience to ACE. [More Info](https://codemirror.net/)

nodes.title: Monaco Editor
nodes.desc: A code editor developed by Microsoft, providing a similar feature set to ACE. [More Info](https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/)

nodes.title: Auto-completion
nodes.desc: A feature that predicts the rest of a word or phrase a user is typing, providing suggestions for completion. [More Info](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autocomplete)

nodes.title: Real-time Collaboration
nodes.desc: A feature that allows multiple users to edit the same document simultaneously, with changes reflected in real-time. [More Info](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real-time_collaboration)

nodes.title: Cloud9 IDE
nodes.desc: A cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that uses ACE as its code editor. [More Info](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cloud9_IDE)

nodes.title: JavaScript
nodes.desc: The primary programming language used for developing ACE and many of its plugins. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript)

nodes.title: HTML
nodes.desc: The standard markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the web, often edited within ACE. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML)

nodes.title: CSS
nodes.desc: The styling language used for controlling the layout and appearance of web pages, often edited within ACE. [More Info](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS)

nodes.title: Emacs
nodes.desc: A family of text editors that inspired some of ACE's features and keyboard shortcuts. [More Info](https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/)

nodes.title: Vim
nodes.desc: A highly configurable text editor that inspired some of ACE's features and keyboard shortcuts. [More Info](https://www.vim.org/)
